intro: Stenomesson ferreyrae, commonly known as the Ferreyra's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other sunflower-related plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
